p: Nurses have a high degree of intra-disciplinary collaboration ( Padgett, 2013) and work in multidisciplinary teams focussed on collaborative care, which is considered an important strategy to improve patient outcomes ( Oandasan, 2006). Teams of healthcare professionals have existed in hospitals for many years, with some experiencing effective collaboration and some not. Within an effective interdisciplinary approach to patient care, Petri (2010) described how collaboration can simply be defined as the act of working together, but that in order for it to be effective, it needs to occur in an atmosphere of mutual trust and respect. These are critical elements for nursesâ€™ to feel in pandemic situations where uncertainty is high.
